support_summary: The autophagy receptor p62/SQSTM1 recognizes and binds to ubiquitinated TDP-43 inclusions, targeting them for degradation via the autophagy-lysosome pathway. It is a common component of TDP-43 aggregates in ALS and FTLD.

functions.cellular_process: p62/SQSTM1 is a selective autophagy receptor that recognizes and binds to ubiquitinated protein aggregates, including those of TDP-43, and targets them to autophagosomes for degradation.
functions.effect_description: p62/SQSTM1 facilitates the clearance of toxic TDP-43 aggregates through the autophagy-lysosome pathway, thereby reducing TDP-43 pathology.
biological_consequence: Ubiquitinated TDP-43 aggregates form → p62/SQSTM1 binds ubiquitin chains on TDP-43 → p62/SQSTM1 binds LC3 on autophagosome membrane → Sequestration of TDP-43 aggregates into autophagosomes → Autolysosome fusion and degradation of TDP-43

ALS-linked SQSTM1 mutations → Impaired binding to KEAP1 → Failure to activate NFE2L2/NRF2 antioxidant response → Increased cellular oxidative stress → Enhanced stress granule formation and TDP-43 aggregation
specific_effects: TDP-43 aggregates co-localize with the autophagy adaptor protein p62/SQSTM1.
Overexpression of p62/SQSTM1 reduces TDP-43 aggregation in a manner dependent on both autophagy and the proteasome.
ALS-FTLD-linked mutations in SQSTM1 can disrupt selective autophagy and increase TDP-43-associated stress granule formation.
Overexpression of p62 can cause the mislocalization of TDP-43 to the cytoplasm, leading to aggregation.

evidence.paper_title: Regulation of TDP-43 aggregation by phosphorylation and p62/SQSTM1
evidence.authors: Brady OA, Meng P, Zheng Y, Mao Y, Hu F
evidence.relevant_quote: Over-expression of p62/SQSTM1 reduces TDP-43 aggregation in an autophagy and proteasome-dependent manner.

evidence.paper_title: ALS-FTLD-linked mutations of SQSTM1/p62 disrupt selective autophagy and NFE2L2/NRF2 anti-oxidative stress pathway
evidence.authors: Deng Z, Lim J, Wang Q, Purtell K, Wu S, Palomo GM, Tan H, Manfredi G, Zhao Y, Peng J, Yue Z
evidence.relevant_quote: disease mutation SQSTM1G427R...[increases] TARDBP/TDP-43 associated stress granule formation under oxidative stress.

mechanism: p62/SQSTM1 is a selective autophagy receptor that recognizes and binds to ubiquitinated protein aggregates, including those of TDP-43, and targets them to autophagosomes for degradation.
effect: p62/SQSTM1 facilitates the clearance of toxic TDP-43 aggregates through the autophagy-lysosome pathway, thereby reducing TDP-43 pathology.
summary: TDP43 activates SQSTM1 to modulate tdp-43 aggregate clearance (autophagy), ultimately affecting autolysosome fusion and degradation of tdp-43.
